info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 31 at 12:43PM MST until July 31 at 3:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...An area of slow moving thunderstorms is bringing 1-2 inches of rain between McNary and Vernon, primarily south of US 60.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast Arizona, including the following counties, Apache and Navajo.
* WHEN...Until 345 PM MST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1237 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Billy Creek, Brown Creek, Rocky Arroyo, Gooseberry Creek, Show Low Creek, Pulcifer Creek, Sepulveda Creek and Vernon Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Vernon. - This includes the following highways... Highway 60 between mile markers 350 and 360. State Route 61 between mile markers 353 and 357.
This includes the following recreation areas and campgrounds... Los Burros Campground and Brown Creek Campground. - Additional information is available at weather.gov/flagstaff.
info.instruction:
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Low water crossings will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON
